content.question: Use the passage to answer all parts of the question that follows. a) Identify ONE non-Western nationalist leader whose actions might be used to illustrate the author’s argument in the passage. b) Explain ONE way in which the “world revolution of Westernization” identified by von Laue in the passage disrupted non-Western societies. c) Explain ONE reason why historians in the late twentieth century reinterpreted Western imperialism in the way that von Laue does in the second and third paragraphs of the passage.

frqParts.text: Use the passage to answer all parts of the question that follows. a) Identify ONE non-Western nationalist leader whose actions might be used to illustrate the author’s argument in the passage. b) Explain ONE way in which the “world revolution of Westernization” identified by von Laue in the passage disrupted non-Western societies. c) Explain ONE reason why historians in the late twentieth century reinterpreted Western imperialism in the way that von Laue does in the second and third paragraphs of the passage.

topic.text: 6.3: Indigenous Responses to State Expansion from 1750 to 1900

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
